definition: carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
Song Dynasty History of Zen Buddhism in China (1252), 20 scrolls

sentences.english: We're gonna get together go to the wonderful light show on the mid-autumn day.
sentences.chinese: 在中秋那天夜晚，我们将一起去看灯会。

sentences.english: The Butter Lantern Festival is an important component of Tibetan folk culture.
sentences.chinese: 酥油花灯会是藏民族民俗文化的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: After the left-turn green arrow, a yellow arrow may appear.
sentences.chinese: 转左带绿色箭头灯后，接着黄色箭头灯会闪亮。

sentences.english: The program demonstrates the function of LED through GPIO configuration. LED will be flickering from left to right in turn.
sentences.chinese: 本例程演示了闪灯的功能，灯会依次从左向右闪烁。

sentences.english: Zhou Cun plays the part of the Yuanxiao lantern show that plays activity and week village tradition already widely known.
sentences.chinese: 周村扮玩活动及周村传统的元宵灯会已家喻户晓。

sentences.english: 《9》 China, Fujian Province Fuzhou first session lantern festival in south back street grand hold.
sentences.chinese: 中国，福建省福州市首届灯会在南后街盛大举行。

sentences.english: Taiwan"s 100th lantern in Maioli, My hometown."
sentences.chinese: 台湾百年灯会在苗栗，我的故乡。

sentences.english: Dialogue 1. Sally and Tim are getting ready to go to the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 莎莉和提姆准备好要去参加元宵灯会。

sentences.english: Riddles are written on lanterns for people to guess.
sentences.chinese: 单身人士会聚集在灯会猜猜灯谜，找个合眼缘的人。

sentences.english: Emperor of the Southern Song Dynasty fully supported lantern show.
sentences.chinese: 南宋的皇帝对灯会也非常支持。

definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
Birthday of the Flowers, spring festival on lunar 12th or 15th February
